images.title: Humphrey Bolton / Entrance path in Bodnant Garden
images.caption: On entering the garden the path passes this large herbaceous border, sheltered by a high wall. Taken in 1993. The area is known as the Range Border Garden. It has recently (information received in August 2009) been renovated and altered following the construction and opening of the new Visitor Centre, which is now to the immediate right of the photograph.

images.title: Philip Halling / Laburnum tunnel, Bodnant Garden
images.caption: When entering Bodnant Garden you pass through this tunnel of Laburnum.

description: These beautiful 80 acre gardens in Conwy have miles of footpaths, wonnderful floral displays and spectacular views across Snowdonia. In the park you will find formal gardens bounded by clipped box hedges, ornamental ponds , tranquil pools, fountains, formal herbaceous borders, an enclosed laburnum arch and many rose gardens. There is also a pretty Pin Mill located on the delightful canal terrace, a steep wooded valley with a stream, the Dell with the river Hiraethlyn flowing through and the delightful Italianate terraces. The gardens are located near Tal-y-Cafn on the River Conwy.
